cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly edging west-northwest tonight, then turning northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast and Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-southeastern Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Intracoastal City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Shell Beach to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle and Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas (including metropolitan New Orleans); Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57+ mph) likely in the metro area beginning Friday and continuing into Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if strengthening occurs before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Lake Pontchartrain and along adjacent tidal waterways near New Orleans, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches of rain with locally up to 25 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Friday night; prolonged high water on the Mississippi River may exacerbate levee/containment issues.
